question: A system administrator issues the apt-get upgrade command on a Linux operating system. What is the purpose of this command?
choices: Every application installed will update itself to the latest version.
Operating system updates are downloaded and will be installed.
The remote repository of applications and dependencies will be updated to the latest version.
A specific application named upgrade will be installed.
answer: Every application installed will update itself to the latest version.

question: A Linux system administrator is searching the passwd file for any username that starts with a digit. Which grep command should the administrator use?
What is the output when the following code is entered into a Python program interpreter?
What is displayed after the following code is entered into a Python interpreter?
choices: nothing ( because the print command is wrong)
(syntaxerror)-…as there should not be a space between the numerical values

question: A Linux administrator is attempting to use a terminal to configure the network interface card on a computer. The administrator receives a message that the administrator does not have necessary permissions to perform the configuration. What should be done prior to the configuration command?
choices: change the chmod permissions on the network configuration file

question: A network engineer needs to review the status of all network interfaces of a server running a Linux operating system. The engineer enters the command ifconfig -a. What is the resuit of this command?
choices: All active interfaces will display information.
The ARP table of the computer will be displayed.
Both active and inactive interfaces will display information.
The host routing table will be displayed.
answer: Both active and inactive interfaces will display information.

question: A system administrator attempts to determine what is causing a computer to perform slower than normal. The administrator issues the ps command. What is displayed by this command?
A user issues the Linux command ls -l myfile.sh to check the permission of the file myfile.sh.
pre:
devasc@labvm:~/Documents$ ls -l myfile.sh
-rwxr-xr-- 1 self test 15 Mar 30 21:24 myfile.sh
choices: Any user in the self group can read, modify, and execute the file.
The user with the user ID of self can modify the file.
The user with the user ID of devasc can modify the file.
All users can execute the file.
Any user in the test group can execute the file.
answer: The user with the user ID of self can modify the file.
Any user in the test group can execute the file.

question: Which Python command creates a conditional control structure?
A user enters the commands as shown. What is the result after the mv command is entered?
choices: The file myfile.sh is copied to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.
The file myfile.sh is copied to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and replaces the file myfile2.sh.
The file myfile.sh is copied and renamed to myfile2.sh in the current directory.
The file myfile.sh is moved to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.
answer: The file myfile.sh is moved to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.

question: A student is learning Python and is reviewing a Python script as follows:
choices: when the input is a float number
when the first print statement fails
when the input is a string
when the if statement is false
answer: when the if statement is false

question:
A user issues a series of Linux commands as shown.
(omitted)$ pwd 
/home/devasc/labs/ansible/backups 
(omitted)$ cd ../..
Which directory is the current directory after the cd command is entered?
A system administrator of a Linux server is searching the passwd file for the username taylor that appears at the beginning of the line. Which grep command should the administrator use?
A user issues the apt-get upgrade command to update system files in a Ubuntu Linux system and receives an error message of “permission denied.” What should the user do to complete the task?
choices: Issue the sudo apt-get install command.
Issue the allow apt-get upgrade command.
Issue the sudo apt-get upgrade command.
answer: Issue the sudo apt-get upgrade command.

question:
A student is learning Python using the interactive interpreter mode. The student issues the commands:
>>> routers=[]
>>> switches=[]
>>> devices=[\"RT1\", \"RT2\", \"RT3\", SW1\", \"SW2\", \"SW3\"]
>>> devices=devices + [\"RT4\", \"SW4\"]
>>> for i in devices:
if \"R\" in i:
routers.append(i)
else: switches.append(i)
>>> switches
What is the result?
Which Python programming function is used to display output?

A user enters the commands as shown. What is the result after the mv command is entered?
devasc@labvm:~/Documents$ pwd 
/home/devasc/Documents 
devasc@labvm:~/Documents$ mv myfile.sh ../Desktop/myfile2.sh
choices: The file myfile.sh is copied to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and replaces the file myfile2.sh.
The file myfile.sh is copied to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.
The file myfile.sh is moved to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.
The file myfile.sh is copied and renamed to myfile2.sh in the current directory.
answer: The file myfile.sh is moved to the /home/devasc/Desktop directory and renamed as myfile2.sh.
